intro: Schoepfia marchii, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Schoepfia marchii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
